page.title: 11LIFE STYLES - PETWORTH RURAL
page.content: Most houses have at least one telephone. There is a public call box at Strood Green. Cordless 'phones are used in some of the bigger houses - these having a range of 300 yards and homing in to a control box in the house to give wider coverage. One house with three telephones had one in the Jaguar car, one in the home-office. Family pets are mostly cats and dogs, though one had a donkey called Orinoco, doing nothing useful, but greatly loved. The dogs are meant for security, but are so glad to see visitors that they are very welcoming - not really doing their duty! In dress everybody is casual, and all classes of society wear the same. For a summer day, ladies have sleeveless cotton dresses, bare legs and sandals; men wear long trousers and shirts.
